text.text_translated:
Two men looked to the north. They looked at the land they owned. The land went on and on. They could not see its end. The fences were very far. They were hard to see. A teenage boy might be bored. He might want to do bad things. He might not follow rules. He might want to leave this place. But he could not get away on foot.

Sam looked at the biggest horse. It kicked the ground. Its heavy feet were hard. Sam wondered if the boy could ride. He thought about the trouble. A person who rides a horse well could find much trouble. This place was far from anyone. But maybe a boy did not know horses. He could find even more trouble. The boy wanted to run away from his father.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Two men looked to the north. They looked at the land. The land went on and on. They could not see its end. The fences were very far. They were hard to see. A teenage boy might be bored. He might be rebellious. But he could not get away on foot.

Sam looked at the biggest horse. It kicked the ground. Its hooves were heavy. He thought: "Can the boy ride?" A good rider could find a lot of trouble here. It was many miles from anyone. But maybe a boy who did not know horses could find even more trouble. He wanted to run away from his father.
